horsentp.display

Class Displayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • horsentp.display.Displayer

  • public class Displayer
extends java.lang.Object
    This is an important object in this framework because it is the "remote control" to all things rendering.

        public void displayImages(java.util.ArrayList<ImageDisplay> display)

        Parameters:
        display - the ImageDisplays to display

      • drawLayer

        public void drawLayer(DisplayLayer layer)
        Draws the specified DisplayLayer to the internal image buffer. Everything in the layer is drawn, and it might accidently cover up previous drawn objects beneath it!
        Parameters:
        layer - the layer that is being drawn

      • drawBuffer

        public void drawBuffer()
        Draws the internal image buffer to the current DisplayCanvas. If you do not call this method, then items will not be displayed properly!

      • createImageDisplay

        public ImageDisplay createImageDisplay(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
        Creates an ImageDisplay object from an image.
        Parameters:
        image - the image to be displayed
        Returns:
        returns an ImageDisplay object to use with Displayer

      • createImageDisplay

        public ImageDisplay createImageDisplay(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                              DisplayLink link)
        Creates an ImageDisplay object from an image.
        Parameters:
        image - the image to be displayed
        link - the DisplayLink object to link to
        Returns:
        returns an ImageDisplay object to use with Displayer

      • moveCamera

        public void moveCamera(float x,
              float y)
        Translates the internal DisplayCamera the specified amount. This and "setCameraLocation" should be the only interaction with the camera, because otherwise it ker-smashes
        Parameters:
        x - the translation on the x axis
        y - the translation on the y axis

      • setCameraLocation

        public void setCameraLocation(float x,
                     float y)
        Sets the location of the internal DisplayCamera to the specified location. This and "setCameraLocation" should be the only interaction with the camera, because otherwise it ker-smashes
        Parameters:
        x - the new location of the camera on the x axis
        y - the new location of the camera on the y axis

      • getCameraLocation

        public Vector2D getCameraLocation()
        Gives the position of the camera.
        Returns:
        the camera's position.

      • setDisplayConfiguration

        public final void setDisplayConfiguration(DisplayConfiguration config)
        Changes the way things are displayed according to a given DisplayConfiguration object
        Parameters:
        config - the DisplayConfiguration object that will tell Displayer how to Display things

      • setDisplayCanvas

        public void setDisplayCanvas(DisplayCanvas drawOn)

      • makeJFrame

        protected javax.swing.JFrame makeJFrame(int width,
                            int height,
                            boolean resizable)

      • createContainedDisplay

        protected javax.swing.JFrame createContainedDisplay(int width,
                                        int height,
                                        boolean resizable)

      • getCanvas

        public DisplayCanvas getCanvas()
        Used to get the drawing canvas. Do not use this for getting and adding input, use InputBridge instead.
        Returns:
        the Displayer's drawing canvas.
